body_html: @dresness Glad you got it working! The nThreads arg is specific to cycleGAN repo though. It really just corresponds to the num_workers of DataLoader in pytorch side. However, setting that to 0 would decrease the training efficiency, especially when data loading and preprocessing is expensive.
body_text: @dresness Glad you got it working! The nThreads arg is specific to cycleGAN repo though. It really just corresponds to the num_workers of DataLoader in pytorch side. However, setting that to 0 would decrease the training efficiency, especially when data loading and preprocessing is expensive.
body: @dresness Glad you got it working! The `nThreads` arg is specific to cycleGAN repo though. It really just corresponds to the `num_workers` of `DataLoader` in pytorch side. However, setting that to 0 would decrease the training efficiency, especially when data loading and preprocessing is expensive.
